medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started the day prior to admission, described as sudden, sharp, and aching; most prominent in the periumbilical and left lower quadrant. The pain has been constant, has worsened with PO intake, and has led to a decreased appetite, with no food intake for the past 2 days. The last bowel movement was this morning, noted to be hard and light-colored, with little blood in the stool and bowl. The patient reports nausea and denies vomiting, with chills reported last night. Currently passing gas.
medical_history.family_history: Father passed from alcoholic cirrhosis, mother has hypertension but is alive, has a healthy sister, no history of cancer in the family.
